p: In addition to the quantity of lipids, The crude protein restriction during growing-finishing period resulted in an increase of MUFA and oleic acid (C18:1n-9) and in a decrease of linoleic acid (C18:2n-6) in accordance with Wood et al. [ 3] C18:1n-9 is the main product of de novo fat synthesis in the pig, and its concentration increases as the pig contains more IMF content. Wood et al. [ 3] also reported that a low-protein, amino acid-supplemented diet increased the percentages of C18:1n-9 and decreased the level of of C18:2n-6. No data regarding fatty acid composition of pork derived from animals fed with a combination of OEO and BA can be found in the literature, and data regarding OEO alone are scarce [ 43].
